headline: ServiceNow Claude Partnership Tests AI First Workflow Thesis For Investors
summary: ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) is deepening its partnership with Anthropic, making Claude the default model for building autonomous agent workflows on its platform. The company is rolling out generative AI solutions across major clients, including new enterprise collaborations with Fiserv and Panasonic Avionics. These moves position ServiceNow as an AI first enterprise platform focused on mission critical workflows in sectors such as financial services and aerospace. ServiceNow enters this AI shift...

headline: AI trade splinters as investors get more selective
summary: The global AI trade is starting to fracture as soaring capex, rising debt loads and doubts over who will profit from the technology force investors to draw sharper lines.  When ChatGPT launched in November 2022, anything linked to the artificial intelligence theme surged - from chipmakers and software firms to raw-materials suppliers ‌and even companies most exposed to AI disruption.  That lifted equity and debt markets to levels that have drawn bubble warnings from regulators and investors, even as the likes of Microsoft, Amazon, Alphabet and Meta mapped ‌out hundreds of billions of dollars in spending.

summary: USMV and other low-volatility ETFs gain appeal as an AI-driven tech rout wipes $1T, spikes VIX, and fuels rotation into staples and value sectors.

headline: BetterInvesting™ Magazine Update on ServiceNow Inc. (NYSE: NOW) and Deckers Outdoors Corp. (NYSE: DECK)
summary: ServiceNow Inc.'s recent report has investors wondering if the company's stock is fairly valued. Or is it in the buy range? As such, the Editorial Advisory and Securities Review Committee of BetterInvesting Magazine considers ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW) as worthy of further study and has named the company its "Stock to Study" for the April 2026 issue for investors' informational and educational use.

headline: Coty Q2 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Coty (NYSE:COTY) used its fiscal 2026 earnings discussion to outline a new leadership agenda centered on tighter focus, fewer priorities, and what management repeatedly described as stronger operational discipline, as the company works through uneven recent performance and a more promotional beauty

headline: Heard on the Street Thursday Recap: Chomping at the Bitcoin
summary: Tech stocks kept falling, continuing the rout that started Tuesday.  A broad array of AI-exposed companies saw their shares decline, including software companies, data-service firms, hyperscalers, and fund managers that invest in software companies.  Thomson Reuters on its Thursday earnings call argued that its legal-research business can't be replaced by general-purpose AI models.

headline: The Software Rout Is Spreading Pain to the Debt Markets
summary: The steep selloff in software stocks is spreading to the debt market.  Pressured by growing worries about the disruptive potential of new AI coding tools, shares of large software companies such as Salesforce and ServiceNow have been sliding for months.

raw.headline: The Software Rout Is Spreading Pain to the Debt Markets
